alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 22 at 9:34AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coast and Valley Locations in Central and Southern San Diego County... * Until 1245 PM PST. * At 934 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain expected across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours. The expected rainfall rate is 0.4 to 0.6 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches, locally up to 1 inch, are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Dangerous flash flooding. Heavy rain producing areas of flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Dangerous flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chula Vista, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Poway, Imperial Beach, Coronado, Del Mar, North Park and Mission Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-0.6 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
